reviews.review:
Art Itself. 
Flows like a river.
Through the streets and the faces.
Of those who you've met.
recommend, nice looking game, interesting story, incredible gameplay.
Best Storyline
生化奇兵营造的天空之城想象力惊人，场景美的好像仙境，身处天空之城，眼前一切目不暇接，景色，新奇的设施，我好像穿越去了美丽的未来新世界。到处照相留念……iMac是不是被这游戏所震撼，现在已经开不了机了……才入坑第一天，看来有必要为这游戏买台台式机了，坐等新卡上市。

历时10个小时，我通关了。
表示之前曾经玩过1代，同样是手柄通关，但是给我的感觉却真的有些不同。
技能方面，主角有元气技能，消耗盐分（蓝条）释放，武器则只能携带两把，更换则依靠捡垃圾，子弹也是依靠拾取，但是有个好处是你虽然只能携带两把枪，但是你可以带上所有种类枪的子弹。
至于射击手感么，我是用手柄玩的，只能说震感简直爽翻，尤其是过剧情的时候，因为是手柄，所以在射击的时候有轻微的射击辅助（游戏自带，不用调整）

然后谈一谈遇到的比较困难的怪物：
1. 爱国者  造型大概就是美国大叔然后后背还有俩翅膀，是机器人，然而魅惑只能魅惑他大概五秒的样子，不推荐魅惑，而且即使魅惑了，它也不会自杀   强烈推荐用暗涌（就是章鱼图案的那个技能）没有强化过的暗涌，一下能让它短路，掉三分之二血，应该是制作组故意这么设计的
2. 长臂制造者  造型大概就是科学怪人加了俩超大机械手臂（概念有点像章鱼博士）  这个我暂时还没有找到比较合适的打法，基本上是火箭筒轰过去的，特别提醒，遇到这个boss一样的怪了千万别上滑道，他会放电然后把你电下来，如果你刚好下方是天空……阿门~骚年一路走好233333     = =不要问我为什么知道……
3. 第一夫人的鬼魂  如名，就是个老女人的鬼魂XD第一次碰到的时候我还很惊慌，死了两次，然后发现技巧了。注意，所有的攻略都会跟你说善用乌鸦，然后杀鬼魂，因为鬼魂召唤的死尸是可以被乌鸦攻击的。然而我要说，你能不脱裤子放屁了么？鬼魂夫人在召唤尸体的时候，会上下浮动，这时候蓄力火球，看准她脱离无敌了直接来一发，不仅操作简单伤害高，而且死尸全都清了（死尸被召唤出来的时候离鬼魂很近）    神tm乌鸦打法劳资死了七八次，火球打法随便过，果然攻略什么的只能是参考

以及这个游戏流程过程唯一有困难的地方大概就是最后去找boss的时候，弹药不足的问题，等你打到那个的时候，个人推荐武器带音爆抢和火箭筒，武器强化的话推荐音爆抢，火箭筒，霰弹枪，至于一代神器小手枪，我懒得用。。。毕竟可以突突突
如果场景出现了狙击枪，不要犹豫，直接换上，因为下面遇到的敌人一定有狙击枪而且刷新地方特别远！！注意是特别远！！如果还想要之前的抢，打完了再换抢就是了

然后游戏打法嘛，因人而异，有几个小技巧：
1.暗涌这个技能是强力拉人推人，因此如果是在空艇之类有高空的地方，可以用来快速推人下去，小兵直接死，当然也会因此捡不到战利品，弹尽粮绝时不推荐
2.乌鸦技能，这个技能建议第一时间升级，控场，有伤害，自动追踪，除了个别敌人不能生效简直就是神技，感觉就是给我两管蓝我能分分钟清场
3.魅惑 第一个得到的技能，但是也是最好第一时间把减少盐分消耗点出来，能节省一半的蓝，而且能增加控制时间还能让被控制的敌人在控制结束后自杀（该技能不能穿墙不能穿过障碍物）
4.冲撞技能，个人比较喜欢，搭配近战距离*3的裤子，那感觉就是乌鸦控场，然后突突突挨个爆头
其余技能我不喜欢暂不评价23333

游戏操作方面的说完了，我们来谈一谈游戏剧情和画面还有音乐
音乐：我就这么跟你说，场景音很到位，以及我已经去找了原声音乐，默默存到了我的乐库
画面：生化奇兵1我打完的时候总共截图70张左右，然而，生化奇兵无限，我截图达到了190张，已经挑选了很多作为以后的桌面，各种景色，各种场合，甚至于各种废墟，我只能用恢弘大气来描述，玩这个游戏我的感觉就是，劳资要开最高画质QAQ好美啊QAQ帅哥好多啊QAQ
剧情：为了不剧透，我就一笔带过，以为是欠债还钱然而最后发现欠的是亲情债= =好吧怎么让我说的有些狗血了。。。。剧情真的超级超级棒，游戏内大量英文语音对话，发音很标准，听起来不算困难，文字的话有汉化组，3DM的就能用

玩完这个游戏我花了两天共计十个小时，然而我觉得，这款作品，这个系列，无论从哪个角度，艺术品这三个字当之无愧，我的电脑硬盘不算大，但是这个游戏，我存了！
Очень хорошая игра. Для своего года, графика очень даже ничего. Концовка игры просто убила! Вобщем, рекомендую!
Good game. Solid 9/10.
If you have yet to get spoiled on about this game, please play it ASAP
Im so happy that i have found this game on steam. it worths every dollar i payed for it. one of the best games i have played ever. Recommended for adventure games lovers.
Just starting to play it, so far so good. Marvelous graphics, good gameplay execution, and story seems to grab the player's attention and interest. Definitely a buy for me.
10/10 would get mind fucked again
juegazo.
its a masterpiece

Sem dúvida é um dos jogos cuja lore mais me atraiu durante tode a minha vida. Os personagens são cativantes, a história é puro mistério que te dá uma vontade enorme de desvendar, além dos cenários incríveis e ótima jogabilidade. Vai ficar sempre como um dos meus jogos favoritos desde que eu o terminei. E Elizabeth é um amorzinho também!!!!!!
Joguem Bioshock Infinite. <3

Good time playing.

I am sorry to give a nono for this but the game itself is lovely.
One of best gameplays ever and each time Elizabeth is at players side it's the best game ever.
But the story ruins everything, quantum theories are fine, but the depressive childish sayings are terrible.
The storyline totally ruined the game for me.
Meilleur jeu auquel j'ai joué de toute ma vie!

I haven't had this many feels since Far Cry 3.

10/10 - Would catch ammo again.

In all seriousness though, one my favorite games ever. Gunplay is tight, except for the god fucking damn piece of shit Burstgun. What is that useful for? Nothing! A nerf gun would have been more useful! Every weapon feels unique. And the use of vigors, although admittedly I forgot to use them during most of the chaotic scenes because I was too busy trying to kill people. Every vigor is awesome though. Bucking Bronco OP, plz don't nerf.

Like I said before, the story is amazing. It's some Doctor Who shit right there, especially at the end. But god damn, if I had to give up my firstborn to get just one mre hour of the story, you bet your ass I would. Kids are annoying anyway.
第一次写测评，就为伊丽莎白。伊丽莎白走后整个人都慌起来了。剧情和音乐超赞。第一个接触的剧情类fps（以前都是无脑突突突），虽然对我这个初中生有点晦涩难懂。强烈推荐！！！（伊丽莎白太美了）

Ok, I just have to come out with it right now and just scream to the entire world, that I had the hugest nerdgasm whilst playing BioShock Infinite! Hands down above all the absolute best friggin' FPS game of 2013! Sorry, anyone who thinks otherwise, I respect your opinions, but right now I just really have to say that I really, REALLY enjoyed this game's anticipated experience it had to offer, thouroughly. The game play over all was spectacular, I know it's taken me this freaking long to even write a simple journal of a review of the masterpiece of a game it was, but at least it's being done. 

It just was the best damn thing I had ever done in my life, yes it was life changing video game, and I regret nothing about the game, I am soooooo damn glad that I forced my sister to buy it for me the day it came out. In order to remember it's magnificence of a gamer success, MY GOD! Yes, I cried like a bitch at the end, there were no doubts that I was mind-raped at the game's finale! It was so complex, and mind boggling that i started to get a bad nosebleed. I loved all the characters, and how they were portrayed, the voice acting, the art work, the character development, everything about the game, hell even the damn time, and history backing up every little damn detail, made the game that much exponentially better! Minds were profoundly blown, it was literally unlike anything i had seen before, Just listen to Saliva's "Ladies and Gentlemen" and the entire damn song pretty much explains the entire feeling of the game. I wish I had honestly went to the bathroom before the ending of the game because it scared the crap outta me, (just an exaggeration mind you). I HIGHLY recommend playing this game and actually really play this game and put the time to notice every detail of it, you will not regret it. Bricks will be shat, minds will be blown, and hearts will be melted. The DLCs for this wondrous game are a blast of excitement, and thrilling trigger-happy game play! That one is called (CITC) "Clash In The Clouds", featuring tons of new challenges, achievements, more action packed gaming. CITC was alright but I honestly feel it was just another bait for those achievement whores out there, but I did however like being a curator for all the unlockables it was hard work, but totally worth it in the end. The second  DLC "Burial At Sea" both episode 1 and 2 was spectacular. It had its holes I feel here and there and didn't make much sense to me at first and I feel went over my head in the beginning but I just decided to roll with it till the end, and by the time that was all paid in full I understood fully what it all meant. (that is after replaying it a couple times). Without further ado, enjoy the game, it's gonna be a hell of a ride! I highly reccomend it! Not just cause I'm a BioShock fan but because it was a good play.
Not my favorite of BioSchocks but still a pretty fun game!
Cool
Superb story.

One of the best stories so far I've ever met in games. Columbia is ridiculously beautiful and you can see a new kind of art in every possible locations as the game goes from light colours to dark ones as the story goes. Only problem I found is that the game gives you 80% of the story at the very end, and it's hard to understand it for the first time, but actually it makes you to play it again. I recommend the DLC Burial at sea, it makes the Bioshock story complete with Bioshock 1. A must have game.
BioShock Infinite очень красивая игра. Геймплей захватывающий и сама игра атмосферная .

Really good plot with great character development and the game also has a unique combat system that makes the game seem extremely fun with vigors as well as the  level/area design for the game and it has a amazing soundtrack.

Don't get bored halfway through.   The second half is the best part.

100점 만점에 99.99점! 스팀하면서 가장 잘 한 일이 이 게임을 산 것이다. 현실을 매우 날카롭게 빗댄 배경과 스토리 짜임, 예측 불가능한 반전도 훌륭하지만 무엇보다 연출이 정말 좋았다. 이 게임을 하면서 게임이 소설이나 영화를 포괄하는 종합예술이 될 수 있다는 확신이 들었다. 개인적으로 FPS를 전혀 즐기지 않는 유저인데도 (업적을 위해) 1999모드를 깨고 스토리 없는 확장팩을 구입했다..

The best game in the Bioshock franchise. A little bit on the short side, but the incredible story, gunplay, new mechanics, and roster of characters definitely make up for it. You're going to want to rush through the shoot out sections just to hear Booker and Elizabeth share their trades of dialogues.

I first played this on ps3 when it first came out. After moving back over to pc gaming I seen it here on steam and it brought back memory's. This game is by far my favorite first person game in existence. It's amazing and anyone that hasn't played it needs to and really get into it. And pc is the better place to play it with mouse and keyboard.

One of the most engaging, beautiful, and complete story games I had the pleasure to play. The weapon and loot mechanics were great, the sound and animation were superb in my mid-range PC, and the story itself is very unique and compelled me to replay the game right after the credits rolled. Highly recommended (bought it at sale price).

SO Good. Great ending and story as well as gameplay. 
P.S A perfect Companion!
One of the better single-player games I've played in a long time

Sfiora la perfezione. Un gunplay che si avvicina di molto agli FPS moderni distaccandosi dalla legnosità dei primi due capitoli, i miglioramenti fatti nel secondo capitolo per quanto riguarda i plasmidi/vigor si notano e fanno bene al gioco. Le ambientazioni sono ispiratissime, con scorci che lasciano davvero senza fiato, splendide quelle diurne così come quelle notturne, sempre con un'attenzione particolare al dettaglio che non lascia sbavature né negli interni né negli esterni. La storia si commenta da sola, come una delle migliori opere cinematografiche o come la serie TV più attesa BioShock: Infinite è capace di far rimanere attaccati allo schermo per diverse ore di fila anche a chi, come il sottoscritto, non ama particolarmente il genere degli sparatutto in prima persona. Già a livelli molto alti all'inizio, prende completamente il volo a 1/4 di gioco circa, con un finale da mozzare il fiato.

Des ambiances magnifique, une histoire plus qu'original, des effets de lumiéres jamais vu pour moi c'est un des plus beaux jeux sur pc, il ne requiert pas trop de ressource et le rendu est exceptionnel. A Acheter sans hésiter pendant les soldes steam car c'est un incontournable !

Прежде чем писать обзор, хочу отметить, что BioShock Infinite очень красивая игра.
BioShock Infinite — компьютерная игра в жанре шутера от первого лица с элементами RPG, стимпанка и научной фантастики. Действие игры происходит в 1912 году в вымышленном летающем городе Колумбия. Главного героя зовут Букер ДеВитт. Он частный детектив и прибыл в Колумбию, чтобы найти девушку по имени Элизабет. Позже, они вместе окажутся в центре войны между рабочими и городскими властями. У Элизабет есть сверхспособность: создавать "разрывы" между параллельными мирами и благодаря этому, они многое узнают про этот город, а также про свое прошлое.
Саундтрек здесь прекрасный, чего только стоит музыка которая играет в меню! Большую часть игры нам придется расправляться со злодеями, в сопровождении очаровательной и очень красивой Элизабет. В игре прекрасная атмосфера. Локации разнообразны, декорации на протяжении всего прохождения будут постоянно изменяться, хочется просто бродить по городу, слушая диалоги прохожих и любоваться красотой, ведь перестрелки иногда надоедают. Подведем итоги: BioShock Infinite игра, с хорошим сюжетом, подбором персонажей, прекрасным саундтреком, отлично проработанными локациями. Рекомендую эту игру к прохождению, потому что каждый уважающий себя геймер обязан сыграть в BioShock Infinite!Думаю за 2013 год это лучшая игра,и если в 2016 или 2017 году выйдет новая часть то она будет в много раз лучше...
игра прям шикос! думала что фигня полная а нет, 2 недели рубал в неё!

The story is very gripping. It drives you. It compels you.
The end is one of the most sad endings i have come across.
10/10.

Inspite of multiple positive reviews, I wanted to give is a thumbs up. This game is a work of art. It does not cut any corners, The breathtaking graphics, memorable music, awesome story with kick-ass ending. It was fun playing it the second time. Dont hesitate, this game is extremely inefficient in disappointing you.

Однажды мы уже отправлялись в темные пучины океана, теперь пора взмыть в небеса...

На смену мрачному и умирающему городу приходит светлый и красочный город Колумбия. Если в восторге не было религии и все полагались на науку, то здесь все веруют в Пророка, что ведет их. Играем мы за Букера Девитта, чье путешествие начинается так же - с маяка. Только мы отправимся не вниз, а вверх. За долги мы взяли за поручение найти девчонку... и это будет самое необычное дело частного детектива...

Новая глава в истории Bioshock во многом отошла от своего предшественника и в ней стало всего меньше: меньше плазмидов (хоть теперь у них и есть по два режима); на место кучи пасивок пришла одежда (теперь можно носить всего 4); пушек хоть и стало с виду, но по сути мы имеем по две вариации одной пушки. Дали щит. Крюк, которым можно скользить по рельсам. И! Добавили одну механику, которая просто преобразила игровой процесс - Элизабет. Эта девушка будет вашим несменным напарником всюду следующей за вами. Убить ее нельзя, и она не атакует, но от нее есть бесценная помощь в бою: она умеет открывать порталы в другие миры. Вас обстреливают со всех сторон? В этом месте Элизабет может поставить преграду. А вот тут будут аптечки. А там патроны. Места конечно фиксированы, но это свежая идея в шутерах. При всем этом она очень живо реагирует на окружение, сразу видно героя делали с любовью.

Многие и называют Бесконечность плохим шутером и отличной игрой. Не знаю насчет геймлейной составляющей, но должен согласится что на первом месте тут сюжет и проработка мира. Левин снова создал чертовски интересный и проработанный мир, который кординально отличается от Восторга (хотя и есть кое какие совпадения, но это не случайно). Сюжет закручен так лихо, что не отпускает до самого конца, хотя, как и в случае с первой игрой вам с самого начала дают подсказки на развязку (это особенно видно при повторном прохождении). Концовка одна из лучших, что была в играх.

Многие до сих пор спорят игры это исскуство или нет? Что ж Кен Левин снова доказал, что игра рассказывать отличную историю как книга, но при этом лично пережить всю ее историю. Жалко, что это скорей его последний проект во вселеной, т.к. он уволился и создал другую компанию, но может это и к лучшему... 

Так же хочу посоветовать установить русскую фанатскую озвучку. Группа людей на голом энтузиазме смогли сделать перевод лучше, чем официальные переводчики. Перерисованы на русский язык куча текстур зданий, переведены и озвучены голосовые записки, исправлены недочёты в переводе официальных переводчиков (видимо переводили с английской версии, а не просто озвучивали нашу), а озвучка наверно считается одной из лучших что были в играх. И это я повторюсь не профессионалы! Для ознакомления можно посмотреть «Трудности перевода» на StopGame.ru

One of the best games I've ever played. I played this game some years earlier on my ps3 and rushed through it. My second run on pc was way more slowly and thanks to that I could appreciate the amazing storyline. Don't buy this game if you don't like taking your time in like checking every corner en listening to all of the in-game dialogues, because only if you do that, you can appreciate this game. But if you do, you are rewarded with an amazing experience.

Let's get this out of the way: Bioshock Infinite is not Bioshock 1 or 2. Not in any way. [DLC review at bottom].

Story: You're Booker DeWitt, you're actually talking and you even have a face. Your mission is to save a mysterious girl to settle a debt. Over the course of the game you will overthrow evil dictators, defeat hordes of enemies and traverse a lot of terrain. All very familiar. The story is very engaging in my opinion. And not even that cliched all the time.

Setting: Instead of being in an underwater city, you're now miles above the ground in a floating city. The dreary, watery surroundings of Rapture make way for the colourful and overly bright vistas of Columbia, at least initially. Shit's going to hit the fan later on as it always does.

Combat: Combat is very fluid, it's faster than in BS 1 and esp. BS 2 in which you were a hulking Big Daddy with no real sprint. You've got a very useful melee attack and there's a variety of medium to long range weapons available. The biggest downside here is that you can only ever carry 2 of those at the same time, which makes a lot of the weapons rather dull reworks of existing weapons (pistol, revolver, machine gun, repeater, burst gun...etc.). Headshots are still the way to go. This time around you also get a recharging shield which makes it easier to take a few risks in dispatching your enemies. However, the combat in itself is a bit dull, which is mainly due to the CoD-style weapons. There's nothing really eye catching here, pistols, machine guns, shot guns, sniper rilfes and grenade/rocket launchers...could have used a few more outlandish weaponry. The biggest and coolest part are the battles with skylines involved. You can use those to quickly traverse the terrain, like in a roller coaster. Enemies will use them as well. They spice things up quite a bit. Boring on the other hand are the huge "handymans" you have to fight from time to time. They are just massive bullet sponges, which takes us to:

Enemies: Enemies usually behave relatively smart and the variety is "ok". Again, nothing too outlandish save for the Handymans (big Ape-like creatures, the Iron Patriots, big metal robots with miniguns and Songbird, a named NPC). Could have used a bit more.

Upgrades: You can upgrade shield, health and "mana", called "Salt" in this game instead of EVE. Also no more Adam. The only currency now are coins, which you can at least carry an indefinite amount of now! You can also purchase different weapon upgrades like more damage, bigger magazine or faster reload times. Again, pretty bland all in all. Upgrades could have made the weapons more interesting. Also you can get as many as you like if you have the cash. The upgrade shops are literally everywhere. "vigors" replace plasmids, but work in the same way, only that you can (again) only ever equip 2 at a time, but at least you can quick select which 2 at all times. There are 8 in total. These can be upgraded to have additional effects, which is quite neat, but requires A LOT of money.

Elizabeth: Your mysterious companion, whom you first have to rescue, then chase and rerescue multiple times will often "find" items for you. That could be money, ammo, health or salt (the latter 3 only in combat, the first only when not in combat). This is handy, but a bit obnoxious at times. She can also open "tears" to other dimensions, either for story reasons just like that to give you access to automated gun turrets, new weapons or health, etc. She's invincible, so at least you don't have to worry about her dying. But she's a pain in the arse anyway. Strictly in a story sense though.

Apart from that there is no more map or objects tab. You have to navigate by constantly pressing "n" to display a short arrow. Also, no more ADAM, as already mentioned, so no Big Daddys, no Little Sisters and no bloody harvesting of angels. The game is very straightforward, but you CAN explore quite a bit and find stuff. There are locked doors and such, which you can only open with lock picks, which you will find throughout the game, or with special keys or other items. They usually contain money and/or character upgrades. Med pack and mana healing are gone though. You can only pick up items but not use them to regain something.

All in all a pretty good FPS, not too challenging on the medium difficulty, but ok, maybe 7/10?

DLC:

Clash in the Clouds: 
Arena shooter. Didn't play it. Doesn't interest me, but works in conjunction with another DLC.

Burial at Sea Ep 1:
Back in Rapture. Yay. Still playing as Booker with Elizabeth as side kick. Not much difference from base game in terms of gameplay, but you can now hold all weapons again. Be prepared: The DLC is MUCH rougher than the base game on the same difficulty level. Directly continues the story from Infinite, so a must have.

Burial at Sea Ep 2:
Completely revamps the gameplay and turns Infinite into a stealth game. You play as Elizabeth and you get new unique weapons and plasmids to stun or avoid enemies. You're supposed to sneak up on enemies and take them out. Directly continues the story from BaS Ep 1. Must have again.

Overall playtime on medium with lots of exploring should take you around 15 to 20 hours for the base game and the 2 story DLCs (which take up around 2 hours for Episode 1 and 4 hours for episode 2). The narrative is well worth it. They've put so much effort into Elizabeth and the world as a whole...for an FPS that is insanely well done.

This game is the third installment in the series of Bioshock games, and this one is much more refined. fleshed out, and organzied than previous installments in my personal opinion. In this game set in the flying city of Columbia, you take the role of Booker DeWitt on a mission to "bring us the girl, and wipe away the debt" in your journey to resuce Elizabeth.

[h1][b]Pros:[/b][/h1]
[list]
[*]Amazing soundtrack
[*]Great graphics
[*]Interesting combat style
[*]More optimized and bug free than previous games
[*]Lots to do mission wise (side missions and extras)
[*]Crazy plot twists
[*]Get to play as a steampunk mafia style dude[/list]

[h1][b]Cons:[/b][/h1]
[list]
[*]Not a ton of variety in the weapons department
[*]There is only one ending, unlike other Bioshock games
[*]Elizabeth has too many mood swings[/list]

Having completed the first Bioshock and finding it rather ok, I was expecting its sequel (not including Bioshock 2 which I haven't played) to be more of the same. For the most part, this turned out to be right. Still, I enjoyed it far more than the original. This is in part due to Infinite being the best kind of sequel; one in which it takes the original and expands upon it, fixing its mistakes all while keeping things familiar to the first game. 
In it, you play as Booker DeWitt, sent to rescue a girl from the sky city of Columbia. While in the original you play in the cramped, dark, and already ruined city of Rapture, Columbia offers a far more open and lively setting, one which I think works much better for the combat in the game. While the wide open spaces in Bioshock Infinite where combat takes place could have easily led to a lot of running around the area, the game wisely implements the skyhook, a method of quickly moving around the arena. The skyhook not only helps with the combat by keeping it interesting and exciting, it also allows for transportation around the city rather seamless. In terms of the combat itself, it plays similarly to Bioshock, except that Booker is only able to carry two weapons at a time, something that I found to be a nice inclusion as it forces the player to think more about which weapons to use at a certain time. Adam is also back, except this time its called vigor for some reason. While Vigors were useful, I found myself only using one or two types of vigors throughout the game. 
Another interesting new addition is the AI partner Elizabeth who follows Booker around, throwing him health and ammo as he needs it. Luckily, Elizabeth is unable to take damage, making her more useful than a nuisance. 
In terms of characters, I found most of them quite interesting, each with their own strengths and flaws, as well as interesting backstories, some found in audiotapes, but much of which won't be revealed until very late in the game.
The overall story is quite compelling; one of the best i've ever seen, but it has its slow moments. Some parts seem a bit pointless, where the player will be forced to complete some random task just to open a door, for example. This is similar to the original Bioshock, but where it differs is in Infinite, on some occasions while what your doing may seem pointless, it will instead be used to lead into and progress the plot in some way, instead of simply being used as a way to extend the games length, as was the case in the original. However, where the story really shines is the ending. Without spoiling anything, its an ending that really stuck with me and made me go back to eariler parts just to see how it all came together. It was certainly a better ending than the original Bioshock at least. 
The DLC for the game is also quite good. It does an excelent job of connecting this game and the original together, and contains things fans of the original will like. 
Overall, one of the better games i've played. While it does have one or two flaws, they're largely overshadowed by everything great about it. If you haven't played the original game, it probably isn't necessary to play before this, as the stories are largely seperated. However, if you plan on playing the DLC, it will spoil major elements of the original. Overall, a truly excellent game, one which I would highly reccomend.

After playing BioShock Infinite on 4K max settings with my dual Fury X's I have to say that the graphics were impressive and all the shadowing, shaders, textures and glare including reflectants being pretty accurate. The story line of this game is immersive and truly wants you to play more and see what happens. It gets sometimes really fictional but that is ok with me as long as it is logical, which it was. 

What really woke me up was the ending of the game, the way how they used time, illusion and universal continuim to show how the same event happens again and again and again in different universes and time periods. It was so fictional that it made me think for a second how the ending made sense and made me want to see a review and clarification on the ending.

I'll admit, first off, I'm no expert gamer. I played the majority of this on Easy mode. I know, I know. Shameful.
The point is, this game is so pretty looking and the story is so incredible. I finished it two days ago, and haven't stopped thinking about it. I thought the game mechanics were simple and fun. Despite loving the game for its plot, I enjoyed all the combat as well. The world of Columbia felt deep and detailed to me. Little things like picking up audio tapes and watching short movies to fill in the history and back story of the game and the world were fun to find. I would absolutely reccomend this to anyone looking for a cinematic, original experience.

Bioshock Infinite seems to be Irrational Games last attempt to "make it big with their franchise, however much like the original when this game was released it was held to critical acclaim, but was never able to attract enough people to make the money irrational games needed. In fact, shortly after this game was made Irrational games were forced to shut down their doors. However, all things considered, Bioshock Infinite was a fantastic conclusion to one of my favorite franchises of all time. The visuals are very bright and creative and take place in an "idealized 1930's America" floating in the sky called by Colombia. The world is incredibly immersive, giving time to show you how this world's racial predjudices are getting out of hand and lets you take some time to see the suburbs and the slums of Colombia. The story in this game is brilliant. I would even argue its the best video game storyline i've ever seen, being a thought provoking look at quantum mechanics and life as it is. You play as Booker Dewitt, a man sent to retrieve a girl from Colombia to wipe away his gambling debt and ends up falling into more than he can handle. He's also subjected to a religous zealot who runs colombia who is the main driving force against Booker throughout the story. As for the gameplay itself, it's rather standard and lackluster. You have basic guns which can only be found or obtained by defeating enemies and for some odd reason your character can only use two at a time. There are vigors, which act as this games plasmids, allowing you to throw enemies in the air, light them on fire, electricute them, etc. Dual wielding vigors and guns feels fantastic. It feels like one misuse of the vigors can cost you everything, which is great in a game like this. The game has you fight several enemies at all times in enclosed arena's. This can start to feel very repetitive very fast and is by far the lowest point of the game. All in all, this game can be summed up as a decent shooter with fun characters , an amazing story and an incredibly satisfying ending. Buy this game. Believe me, the story alone is more than worth the price of admission.

sorry for late review. paid full price and was quite disappointed with this game. just didn't feel the same as the previous titles. and the blantent in your face racism being a plot point is kinda F****ed up. if you get it cheap or free it'd be alright but it took me this long to express my distaste of having wasted 80bux

13年就下载了生化奇兵无限的盗版，15年暑假买的正版，两个月后在gmg补了季票，一周后某宝买的武器dlc，最近两天才拿出来通关了。。。。dlc没玩呢，主线通关成就解锁了27/80（还是稍微注意解锁成就的结果。。。）怎么说呢，感觉开始剧情云里雾里，音乐太好了，超有美国20年代的感觉，凭借自带的中文和放映机隐藏的剧情（其实没看过几个，主要是跳过），和网上的大神理解，剧情理解了个大半，不得不说剧情还是很有深度的，编剧真的太吊了。。。剧情隐藏要素真的不错！！！！不愧是花费了巨资打造的游戏，果然游戏质量与投资成正比的，不过可惜，玩家玩的爽了，收不回来本，部门都解散了，参考小岛的合金5，,烧了不知道多少钱，游戏还是个半成品，konami到现在本钱没收回来，逼他们只能停止开发除了实况足球意以外的一切游戏。。。不得不说，投资太大了，风险也大啊。。。哎，也就cod那种巨额投资能得到巨额回报的了。。。

艹，跑题了，我不是什么高端玩家，中等难度通关，也死了10次左右，射击手感嘛，还是很不错，各种技能眼花缭乱的，有一点rpg元素，因为要给武器技能升级。但是实际玩下去只用那么几个武器好用，而且只能带俩，不像德军总部那么变态。。。。技能也是多但是鸡肋的比较多，如果不是为了某些武器和技能成就，估计没几个人会用某些比较难用的武器或者技能。剧情为了防止剧透，也不讲了，总之挺好的，玩了就知道，这游戏可以说是steam吧标配吧2333，,不玩很后悔的。键位的话，玩惯了其他fps的可能觉得不舒服，只需要改建就行。画面上嘛，首先画风问题，不好比较，但是总之哥伦比亚城真的好美，夜晚的星空好美！！！！！！疯狂F12！！！  还有伊丽莎白更美啊。。。。。好漂亮，尤其是后期的装束，怪不得好多国外妹子coser喜欢她！！太有料了，那个腰，那个胸，那个呻吟，啧啧啧，好想摸两把！！！


画面9.8/10：虽然渲染方式不是目前3a大作的主流写实风格，但是让人很舒服，不会晕，景色超美，收集30多处望远镜的画面，每处都很震撼！！！40g不是盖的！！

音乐：10/10 音乐真的是这几年我觉得配乐数一数二的了，没的黑，很有代入感，不是那种让你感到莫名其妙的，一切都是那么契合，让人在战斗时感到紧张，在欣赏美景时感到温馨，不同音乐衔接的也很好，一切都烘托的十分到位

剧情：9.5/10 前面说过，剧情真的超级赞，为何还要扣0.5分？不是满分嘛？原谅我是用一代生化奇兵的眼光来看无限的，一代实在是太惊艳了，尤其是剧情的深度，反映了很深层次的人性，人伦以及各个方面的问题，就像好多人说的太哲学，简直比无限还晦涩深奥，更有深度，2代试图超越1可惜一派涂地，当然2也是个优秀的游戏，不过跟一代比，差距太大了，无限花费巨资，也没能达到1代高度，只只能说接近，而且玩家评分也说明了一切：一代96，无限94,二代88，大家可以不妨试试一代，提醒下，一代恐怖气氛太浓郁了，很压抑，孤身一人在海底，面对恐怖的怪物，没有女儿的陪伴，你会觉得很害怕的，有个准备哈。

总评：9.9/10 绝对的神作，本体如果不刻意收集需要要10小时吧，但是dlc真良心，流程也超级长，海葬两部曲加起来差不多有本体的一半多，收集要素，隐藏剧情一样多，总共80个成就和众多隐藏剧情元素和彩蛋，让人也有二周目的欲望！！！这几年dlc超级良心的也就巫师3还有这个了吧。。。。




不是评测大手子，写得很垃圾，忘见谅，还有，好想艹女儿伊丽莎白啊。。。。当一次鬼父又何妨！！！
Что же сказать, игра божественна, качество, проработка деталей, сюжет, все на высоте, не буду говорить про стиль, он тут великолепен. Советую всем, кто уже играл, со мной бы наверняка согласился))
非常好的一款游戏！无论是游戏性，还是剧情，感觉都非常出色。尤其是剧情方面，看了别人的解释才基本明白，完全可以拍成电影了！！

- game can become a bit tedious. combat eventually seems to be the same thing over and over again towards the end of the game. 
- graphics arent amazing, even at maxed out. My integrated graphics laptop could handle it at around high.
Oyun evreni tarihinin gelmiş geçmiş en mükemmel hikayelerinden biri, bu hikaye üstüne bioshock'un mükemmel oynanış tarzı, mükemmel bir son, her oyunseverin bitirmesi gereken bir oyun. 10/10
7.5 The game is good, but the ending leaves much to be desired

Wow.  This game is brilliant.  I'm not a big FPS guy, but a good story can draw me in, and this game has that in spades.  BioShock Infinite offers a look at an alternate early 20th-century world where religion and patriotism have merged in an extreme way to form a really fascinating culture that's not afraid to challenge you, and it does so very well.  Not entirely sure how much sense the ending makes, but it is still awesome and worth playing the game to see, along with everything else about the story.

I can't get over how much I loved this game, it's tons of fun from start to finish.  There are not many games as narratively ambitious as this one and even fewer that choose to have a character-driven story. The relationship between the two main characters is incredibly compelling. Two thumbs up, definitely buying the DLC.
Oyun mekanları eviniz gibi olan oyunlar vardır. Çok oynadığınızda rüyanızda devam ettiğiniz oyunlar vardır. İşte bu oyun o türden. Hayatımda oynadığım en iyi 5 oyundan birisi diyebilirim.
somebody ! this game is very very good

Played it when it was released on my Xbox 360, loved it then and just done with a second play through, and loved is as much as last time. Great story and great graphics. Love the era and style they have choosen. A must play game 9/10.
